cyclone.name: MICHAEL
cyclone.current_location: about 180 mi SSW of Panama City, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving north, then turning northeast across the Florida Panhandle/Big Bend and through Georgia and the Carolinas before exiting off the Mid-Atlantic coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Panhandle near the Panama City–Mexico Beach area

weather_observation.watch_coast: Chassahowitzka to Anna Maria Island FL (including Tampa Bay) • Mississippi/Alabama border to Mouth of Pearl River • South Santee River SC to Duck NC
weather_observation.warning_coast: north of Fernandina Beach FL to South Santee River SC (Atlantic) and Alabama/Florida border to Suwannee River FL (Gulf)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Panhandle and Big Bend, coastal Alabama, Georgia coast (including Brunswick), and the Carolinas
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (35–45 mph) with higher gusts possible late Wednesday night through Thursday
weather_observation.storm_surge: No significant storm-surge inundation expected along the Georgia coast
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–6 inches with local amounts up to 8 inches could cause flash-flooding in coastal Georgia
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes and dangerous seas/rip currents impacting vessel operations and cargo handling
